intro: Guapira longicuspis, commonly known as the long-toothed guapira, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves with distinctive long, sharp teeth along the margins. It produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
